title.narrative: Addressing the Protection Needs of Populations Affected by the Floods in Unity and Upper Nile

description.narrative:
The project will provide lifesaving protection support to the most vulnerable, flood affected people (72,189) and affected host communities (8,000) in Unity and Upper Nile States by enhancing UNHCR’s protection response, targeting a combined total of 80,189 affected people.
With the CERF allocation, UNHCR are scaling up the emergency protection response for IDPs and host communities, and addressing protection and lifesaving needs of the flood affected populations, particularly the Persons with Specific Needs (PSNs) such as vulnerable women, girls and persons with disabilities (PwDs), through community-based protection networks, targeted multi-sectoral support for PSN, referrals, firewood support to mitigate GBV risks, CwC - to name a few.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Addressing the Protection Needs of Populations Affected by the Floods in Unity and Upper Nile

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Delivery of targeted individual protection assistance.
Number of people benefitting from core GBV services
PP.1b Number of people benefitting from referral pathways.
Strengthening of community-based protection and protection mainstreaming.
Number of monitoring missions to identify and assess the situation of the flood affected population, conducted that inform the humanitarian response.
PP.2 Number of community-based protection mechanisms established to identify, prevent, mitigate and respond to violations of International Humanitarian Law and Human Rights Law.
